title: Cannot build from source with anaconda python2.7
body_html:
I get a string problem when I try to build pytorch/caffe2 from source with anaconda python2.7.
I create a virtual env with python2.7. And I activate the env. Then I try to build pytorch/caffe2. However, the result package is for python3.6. I think the problem is the same as caffe2 issue 2360

If I run

echo $PATH

I get

/home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin:/usr/local/cuda/bin:/home/dell/anaconda3/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games

You can see that the /home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin is before /home/dell/anaconda3/bin. But I still get python3 package.
The output of

which python

is /home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin/python.
The output of

python --version

is Python 2.7.15 :: Anaconda, Inc.

When I build it, I get the the following output

++ python --version                                                               
++ grep --only-matching '[0-9]\.[0-9]\.[0-9]*'                                                  
+ PYTHON_VERSION=2.7.15

I think the program already get the right python version as I want. However, the result python version of caffe2 is still python2.

body:
I get a string problem when I try to build pytorch/caffe2 from source with anaconda python2.7.
I create a virtual env with python2.7. And I activate the env. Then I try to build pytorch/caffe2. However, the result package is for python3.6. I think the problem is the same as [caffe2 issue 2360](https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/2360)

If I run 
```
echo $PATH
```
 I get 
```
/home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin:/usr/local/cuda/bin:/home/dell/anaconda3/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games
```
You can see that the /home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin is before /home/dell/anaconda3/bin. But I still get python3 package.
The output of 
```bash
which python
```
is /home/dell/anaconda3/envs/detectron/bin/python.
The output of 
```
python --version
```
is Python 2.7.15 :: Anaconda, Inc.

When I build it, I get the the following output
```
++ python --version                                                               
++ grep --only-matching '[0-9]\.[0-9]\.[0-9]*'                                                  
+ PYTHON_VERSION=2.7.15
```
I think the program already get the right python version as I want. However, the result python version of caffe2 is still python2.
